New study is finding a simple rules change in college football could dramatically cut the risk of concussions NPR's Jon Hamilton reports on research in the journal of the American Medical Association
More than twenty percent of concussions in college football occur during kick us when players often collided full speed so in two thousand Fifteen Ivy League schools moved to kick off line five yards up the field the idea was to make it less likely that the ball would be returned
